snippet: The Mo Ibrahim award, a prestigious multimillion-dollar prize, has not been awarded in four of the past five years, raising questions about democratic advances.
abstract: Multimillion-dollar prize offered annually to African leaders for good government goes unawarded for fourth time in five years, renewing questions about stringency of its rules, paucity of candidates and state of democracy on the continent; prize is endowed by Sudan-born telecommunications billionaire Mo Ibrahim.
lead_paragraph: The Mo Ibrahim award, a prestigious multimillion-dollar prize, has not been awarded in four of the past five years, raising questions about democratic advances.

headline.main: Again, No African Leader Wins Annual Good Governance Prize
headline.print_headline: Again, No African Leader Wins Annual Good Governance Prize

keywords.value: Ibrahim, Mo, Prize for Achievement in African Leadership
keywords.name: subject
